intro: Homalium luzoniense, commonly known as the Luzon hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, or white. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptical in shape. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is primarily a wild species.
